Tavatron groaned in her semi-conscious state. A million thoughts raced 
through her mind, consuming her, overwhelming her.  She tried to fight them 
off, to return to the battle, but she couldn�t, something was holding her 
back. Her mind began to drift, to wander about her own lost memories, when 
suddenly her optics snapped open. The force of awakening so suddenly sent 
her mind spinning. She shut her optics for a few moments, waiting for the 
spinning sensation to subside.

Tavatron had no idea why she had awakened so suddenly, all she knew was that 
she was awake now, back among the living so to speak. Only moments ago she 
had felt Dinobot�s arms about her, protecting her from some unseen danger. 
Tavatron turned her head in his direction, blinking a few times in order to 
clear her blurred vision:

"Computer, status report."

Internal comp: "Damage to outer armor minimal. Optic lasers at 10% and 
failing. Suggest returning to beast mode for internal repairs."

Tavatron growled to herself, she was in no immediate danger, internal 
repairs could wait. She brought her hand to her face and roughly wiped 
away... mech-fluid? Her internal computer had said there was no major damage 
to her outer armor, so why was her face dotted with mech-fluid?
She could sense no facial wounds, so why so much fluid? Sh finally looked up 
at Dinobot, as if seeing him for the first time. His armor was scrapped, if 
not for his TM2 design he would�ve been dead long ago. Tavatron quickly 
climbed to her feet, kneeling at his side. She did a quick scan of his 
systems, trying to assess the damage. One thing was certain, he needed a CR 
chamber, now. She knew she couldn�t touch him, her touch, no matter how 
gentle, would hurt like hell on his obviously slagged body:

"C�mon Dinobot, you have to stand up." A certain amount of panic and concern 
was evident in her voice:

"You can�t die! I won�t let you!"

The defiance in her voice was not directed at him, but rather at the fates 
that she dared to challenge. She wasn�t going to just stand by and let him 
die, by Primus she had to do something!
